title: Managed Consensus

ALL_TEAM_MEMBERS: Thorne and Kessler coordinating $12B intervention campaign for 'red zones'
Red zones: regions with low consensus due to authoritarian governments, conflict, poverty
Commission voted 23-4 in favor of intervention strategy
Prometheus funding 60% of intervention ($7.2B), governments/donors funding 40% ($4.8B)
Sofia building parallel grassroots network funded by small donors ($2B budget)
Intervention campaign launched, showing early results (red zones climbing from 35% to 48%)
Marcus_Reid: Opposed intervention strategy at commission meeting
Decided to support Sofia's alternative grassroots approach
Concerned that managed consensus violates ethics test
Watching both campaigns unfold, uncertain which is right
Sofia_Navarro: Built network of grassroots activists across all red zones
Coordinating alternative campaign focused on authentic engagement
Sees Thorne/Kessler approach as colonialism with better PR
Yuki_Tanaka: Supporting technical infrastructure for both campaigns
James_Kessler: Sees it as triage, not manipulation
Built coalition of governments and donors for funding
Evelyn_Thorne: Funding education centers, exhibitions, influencer outreach
Argued for 'ethics without results is philosophical masturbation'
Ambassador_Chen: Challenged Marcus on whether perfect legitimacy is necessary
